p: There was negative correlation between the phenolic, proanthocyanidin, and flavonoid constituents and the IC 50 FRAP antioxidant capacity in the flesh of M. sinensis ( r = −0.092; −0.462 and −0.067), while the peel correlated positively ( r = 0.799; 0.260 and 0.318). Conversely, in M. paradisiaca, the IC 50 FRAP antioxidant capacity of the flesh correlated positively with the phenolic, proanthocyanidin, and flavonoid constituents ( r = 0.690; 0.471 and 0.597), while the peel showed negative correlation ( r = −0.866; −0.946 and −0.986) ( Table 7).
